content.description:
I did this climb quiet a long time ago, and it stands out as one of the best single pitches in The Monument. There is a plaque at the base. I seem to remember the upper third of the route being the crux protected by some green Aliens. The climb follows a small crack recessed in a shallow squeeze. I remember doing some squeezing next to a large block that seemed to be fairly secure, but you never know.... You end up jamming with one hand and doing the Wiggle Worm with your body. It is a great climb to do if hiking all the way to

Super Crack of the Monument

.
content.protection: I would take one of each up to a #1 and maybe 3-5 #0.5 Camalots with a few green Alien size, too. There are anchors at the top. Bring two ropes to rap.
content.location:
This route is roughly a 200 feet up canyon from

Supercrack

. Look for a plaque and a splitter!

content.description: Climb a 15 foot detached pillar before reaching the crack. Start out on thin hands, to perfect hands, to wide hands (majority of the climb is BD #3s), then back to hands near the top.
content.protection:
BD C4s #2s and #3s also found a spot for a #4.

There are camouflaged anchors at the top.
content.location: At the mouth of Red Canyon on the East-facing buttress, look for the detached pillar and the obvious splitter.
